DOC.brief_summary: Aim is to evaluate outcomes of inguinal hernia repair incorporating the standard Lichtenstein (open) repair using Biodesign IHM in a double blind (physician evaluator and patient will be blinded), randomized, prospective comparative study with polypropylene mesh. Primary outcome is recurrence at 1 year. Hernia recurrence will be confirmed via ultrasound or CT scan.
DOC.brief_title: Inguinal Hernia Study Using Biodesign IHM
DOC.criteria: 18 years of age Diagnosis of Unilateral inguinal hernia repair Able to provide written consent Incarcerated hernia Allergic or religious beliefs that disallow porcine material Previous hernia repair on the designated hernia site Class IV or V anesthesia requirements Bowel obstruction Peritonitis Life expectancy < 3 years
